summary: IRS offers a range of online services, including services that allow taxpayers to track refunds or view their accounts. Although IRS recognizes that taxpayers want more online options, it hasn’t considered taxpayer input in developing new services. Also, its efforts to determine whether current online services meet taxpayer needs haven’t yet been sufficient to make decisions about how to move forward. IRS has long relied...
title: Tax Administration: Taxpayer Input Could Strengthen IRS's Online Services
